column3:
Design doesn't feel quite right to me.

How about something like:

getpeerinfo   : returns list of peers (ip address, inbound/outbound, etc)

getstat "which_stat_to_get"  : generic RPC call for getting internal state of bitcoin...
getstat "which_stat_to_get" would make it easier to wrap up in a snmp style poller, e.g. for graphing with an rrd tool frontend.\n

@gmaxwell all the kernel interfaces that SNMP uses tend to return groups of statistics that the kernel finds easy to generate together (tx pkts, rx pkts, rx bytes, tx bytes, collisions, ...)  I see the same pattern elsewhere.  So perhaps 'getstat $STAT' can return complex objects, if it is natural to do so internally.\n\nRegardless... closing.  will work on 'getpeerinfo' and then see what's left.\
